medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed diffuse abdominal pain the evening before admission, which was exacerbated by motion. He rated the pain as 8 out of 10 and experienced associated symptoms of abdominal distention and nausea. He took famotidine without relief. One day prior to admission, he had a normal bowel movement.
medical_history.past_medical_history: A diagnosis of anorexia nervosa (restrictive form) made 4 years earlier. Prior to admittance, he had experienced weight loss, early satiety, and decreased caloric intake, leading to a loss of 2.3 kg in the 2 months before admission.
medical_history.family_history: Before the onset of the patientâ€™s illness, the mother had participated in diet programs and dieting was frequently discussed in the family. The father has a history of delayed puberty, hypercholesterolemia, and panic attacks.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a college student living alone in a dormitory. He played sports, ran 8 km (5 mi), and lifted weights on alternate days. No smoking, alcohol consumption, or illicit drug use was reported.
